IBA_J.Spectra

Class Spectra

  • java.lang.Object
    • IBA_J.Spectra.Spectra

  • public final class Spectra
extends java.lang.Object
    Class Spectra responsible for generating a spectra object using an ADC object, and optionally the boundary energy values.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Spectra(ADC adc, java.lang.String filename)
      This is the basic constructor when you want to create a Spectra from an ADC
      Spectra(ADC adc, java.lang.String filename, float energyMin, boolean startAtEnergMin)
      Use this constructor if the Spectra does not start at channel 0
      Spectra(ADC adc, java.lang.String filename, GeneratedMap generatedMap)
      Use this constructor if the Spectra is generated from an ImageGenerated
      Spectra(ADC adc, java.lang.String filename, GeneratedMap gMap, float energyMin, boolean isStartingAtEnergyMin)
      Use this constructor if the Spectra is generated from an ImageGenerated and does not start at channel 0

      • Spectra

        public Spectra(ADC adc,
               java.lang.String filename)
        This is the basic constructor when you want to create a Spectra from an ADC
        Parameters:
        adc - the ADC source to build the spectra
        filename - name of the file (ex : "name".pixe (or an other extension) contains the ADC information)

      • plot

        public FrameSpectra plot(java.lang.String windowTitle,
                         java.lang.String graphTitle,
                         int nROI)
        This method creates a new plot using FrameSpectra
        Parameters:
        windowTitle - title of the windows where the Spectra will be draw
        graphTitle - title of the component where the Spectra will be draw
        nROI - the number of selected ROI
        Returns:
        a frame of the class FrameSpectra, use showVisible to affich

      • getIndex

        public int getIndex(float energyToSearch,
                    boolean isLowerBounded)
        Parameters:
        energyToSearch -
        isLowerBounded -
        Returns:
        the index corresponding to the energy which is closer to energyToSearch in function of rightIncluded

      • searchMax

        public int searchMax(java.lang.String direction)
        Use this method to search the max "x" or "y". It will help to define the resolution of an ImageGenerated
        Parameters:
        direction - give the element to search : "x", "y" or "E"/"e" are accepted (all other values will be considered as "E")
        Returns:
        the max value of the given element (valToSearch)

      • elementMap

        public GeneratedMap elementMap(float minEnergy,
                               float maxEnergy)
        generate a chemical Map from an energy window as a new ImageGenerated using this Spectra
        Parameters:
        minEnergy - float value as min channel
        maxEnergy - fload value as max channel
        Returns:
        a chemical element map

      • elementMaps

        public GeneratedMap[] elementMaps(float[][] rois)
        same as generatePicture(start,end) but read the ADC only once for several ImageGenerateds
        Parameters:
        rois - array containing the two bounding values for each ImageGenerated
        Returns:
        a table containing all calculated maps
